userreviews.userReview: Just like some of the other reviews, the first part was cheesy, but I had a long car ride to listen to it. They bring up some good points about communication and really listening to each other. I really enjoyed the last cd to hear their life story and where they have come from.

I am listened to the book on my IPod. Brian and I just got called to teach the marriage and family relations class. Lots of good suggestions... lots!!! not sure if Brian would ever get to excited about some of them, but good info for me :)

It took me about 3 days on and off, to listen to this talk while my son was in school for about 3 hours. I really enjoyed the insight that their Counseling and Family Relationships bring. I enjoyed the section on Validation most. This talk is probably most helpful if you listen to it, with your spouse, in full.
The first part of this CD was a little cheesy, but I really enjoyed the second half. It brought up many great points about marriage, and just how to make it better. :)

description: Renowned speakers, marriage and family experts, and best-selling authors Gary and Joy Lundberg share their life-learned lessons about marriage, family, and relationships in Building Forever: Making Your Marriage More Fulfilling, One Day at a Time. In this enlightening and entertaining seminar, the Lundbergs discuss such things as celebrating the differences between men and women, understanding the four rules of validation, improving listening skills, and making it through challenging times as a couple.Drawing on their experience with marriage counseling and workshops and sharing their unique husband-and-wife perspective, the Lundbergs reveal practical tools every spouse can use to create a mutually satisfying marriage--starting today. Building Forever makes a perfect gift for newlyweds and is a great resource for seasoned couples as well.
title: Building Forever: Making Your Marriage More Fulfilling, One Day at a Time
